alert.note: Alert for St Croix; St.Thomas...St. John.. and Adjacent Islands (Virgin Islands) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 28 at 5:03AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. Expect additional rainfall amounts of 1 and 2 inches and locally higher amounts. * WHERE...Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Mudslides are possible along steep terrains. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Additional showers over saturated soils and excessive runoff from previous rainfall could lead to flash flooding and mudslides in areas of steep terrain. A near-stationary surface trough will likely result in excessive heavy rainfall through at least today. Mainly across eastern and southern Puerto Rico. Across the rest of the islands, there is still the potential for showers and isolated thunderstorms to develop.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: St Croix; St.Thomas...St. John.. and Adjacent Islands
